oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Entwicklung des Ökologischen Landbaus in Deutschland von 1997 bis 2003
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Eichert, Christian
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Policy environments and social economy
History of organics
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Looking at the degree of development of the German organic farming sector, one can assess an explicit headway from the year 1997 until 2003. As a “trigger event” and crucial for the advancement of the sector one can put on record the readjustment within the Ministry of Consumer Protection, Food and Agriculture in 2001, caused by the BSE crisis. A Consequence was the creation of an organic farming scheme (BÖL) and the state-aided promotion of “Biosiegel”, a new formed organic label. The politically encour-aged trend initiates a go-ahead spirit and a broad establishment of organic farming inside the German farming community.
